dt.t: The lost children had not been found. Public prayers had been offered up for them, and many and many a private prayer that had the {wi}petitioner's{/wi} whole heart in it; but still no good news came from the cave.
The high court held that when a petition charges an official with violating the law, the {wi}petitioners{/wi} must at least have knowledge of facts which indicate an intent to commit an unlawful act.
The {wi}petitioner{/wi} contended that the taking of the blood sample and the admission of the test results violated his fifth amendment privilege against self-incrimination …

… the draft of the proposed petition was read at length: and the petition said, as all petitions DO say, that the {wi}petitioners{/wi} were very humble, and the petitioned very honourable, and the object very virtuous; therefore (said the petition) the bill ought to be passed into a law at once …

Included in Wednesday's court filing was a petition signed by more than 500 area residents. The {wi}petitioners{/wi} ask that Johnson {ldquo}be shown mercy and not subjected to a jail term{rdquo} because he has lost so much due to the conviction.

shortdef: one who makes, submits, or signs a petition
